<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Brinesoul](/Feats.aspx?ID=2606) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Lineage" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=317" />
<trait label="Undine" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=314" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Ancestry Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=74) pg. 118 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

</column>

---

Your elemental ancestor's legacy asserts itself as brackish water, like the seawater of the ocean. You gain the Salt Wound reaction.

**Salt Wound** <actions string="Reaction" /> ([undine](/Traits.aspx?ID=314)) **Frequency** once per day; **Trigger** A creature that has blood and is not at its maximum Hit Points hits you with a melee Strike; **Effect** You channel salt and brine from your blood into the creature's wounds. The creature must attempt a Fortitude save using your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher. On a failure, the creature takes 1d6 [persistent acid damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) and is [sickened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=34) by the pain. On a critical failure, it instead takes 2d6 persistent acid damage and is sickened 2.
name: Brinesoul
